_header: Not dreamed I in the mount of Parnassus
_description: Burgh’s poem in praise of Lydgate — eight stanzas rhyme royal

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
Nat dremyd I in þe mownt of pernasene dranke I nevar at
                    pegases welle…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…of the moneth when this vnadvisid lettarwrit was but with
                    yowr helpe here aftar bettar
BLAdd29729.Note:
Heading f. 6, of which at least one line cropped (bottoms of letters
                    still visible), ending ‘…booke dwelyng at
                    wyndsorre’.
BLAdd29729.Attributed Author:
Explicit per Mag[ist]rum burgh ad Ioannem lidgate (f.
                    6v)
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
Maister Burgh in þe prays of John Lidgate [written out of Maister
                    Hanlay his] booke dwelyng at Wyndsor (f. 6; but see note above)
BLAdd29729.Editions:
Steele,  Robert,
                        ed.  
             Lydgate and Burgh’s Secrees of Old Philisoffres: A version of the
                ‘Secreta Secretorum’.

             English Verse between Chaucer and Surrey.
         Durham, NC: Duke UP, 1927: 189-90.
Förster,  Max. 
             “über Benedict Burghs Leben und Werke.”
